place_description:
Take a step back in time and enjoy the relaxed shopping experience of the 1920’s General Store, and sit with friends at our cafe, or relax with a good book in a comfortable reading space. Enjoy free WiFi while you spend time with us. We will offer in-house roasted coffees, bulk coffees, teas, spices, oils and vinegars.
Our cafe will offer specialty coffees, teas, soft drinks, and light snacks, such as pastries.
In addition, there are a variety of exclusive and reasonably priced items for your entire family.
We are open!!!
Stop by anytime and visit !

reviews_data.review_text: It's our favorite local shop! Great coffee, great atmosphere and GREAT customer service!

Adorable coffee, tea and gift shop. First time in and glad I stopped by. Purchased coffee and some gifts for my boss and some seasoning for myself. Ofcourse I had to try an iced coffee as well. Will return. Support local y'all!

Lovely old building filled with Quality oils, coffee, and unique gifts.

Deliciousness served with a genuine smile!
The White chocolate pumpkin was superb
Cool little coffee shop. Rachel is very nice and accommodating! Happy to do business with them over and over!
It's a great place to hang out with friends. I love the variety of teas and coffees. It's also nice to do a little shopping. Very cozy and the barista is awesome.

Great coffee spot that brews the coffee right here, got a cortado and two half pound bags of third shift and creme brulee. Nice place great atmosphere and very helpful staff. will definitely be coming back for more coffee

I love this coffee shop it is my favorite one. It is much better than Starbucks. This place has a very nice shopping area that has infused vinegars and oils. I love getting the strawberry balsamic vinegar and using it on salads. It is delicious.
Wow! What a great coffee shop in downtown Gastonia!! Great coffee, friendly service and a warm, inviting place to enjoy the experience.
Great place to grab coffee! Very welcoming and fun, coffee tasted great, the atmosphere was good quiet enough for conversation but loud enough to not hear everyone else's!
Love this place, so friendly.   Great coffee!!!

Very cozy and relaxing atmosphere. Ordered a Frappe and it was amazing! They made it just right, super sweet, just the way I like it.

Personally. As someone who is boycotting Starbucks and who has hated them for a while, this place is even better and just a perfect coffee shop overall!
Family-owned local shop with vintage feel and locally made and brewed coffee.
Absolutely adorable little coffee shop with a fun little storefront - also the biggest selection of herbs and spices I've seen in the area!
Great  place with history.. neat little store . Friendly staff. Cool spot to check out .
Such a cool place. The coffee is great. Awesome selection of olive oil and balsamic vinegars. Check it out.
What a gem. This coffee shop is truly phenomenal. I love everything about this place.

Quant shop, with a good selection of balsamic vinegar, infused olive oil, and coffee beans, as well as a variety of fresh brewed specialty coffees. Gifts, nick-nacks. It's worth a the trip from Hickory

Fantastic place!

First time as a local trying out this place. I wish I've known this place a long time ago! The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable. The coffee is delicious and so happy they support local businesses (donuts, sandwiches, and different gifts to purchase). They have the cutest gifts, different spices, and olive oil to choose from. This place screams coffee shop vibes- a must go!

Thank you!!

I own a small coffee bar in Stanley NC but had to check out another local coffee shop and it did not disappoint. This place is so beautiful and the atmosphere is relaxed. The staff is very friendly and attentive.
Little coffee shop in the back of a shop that has a wide selection of flavored olive oils and spices.
Was introduced to this coffee house. Enjoyed my purchase n will return for some more coffee beans

GILMORE'S MERCANTILE
GREAT Coffee shop and store. Great couple who own and run the place. Don't miss this place. The shop front is ON Franklin Blvd.
Our GPS went kind of stupid when trying to find them. If you are heading WEST in Gastonia, Wilkinson Blvd, (or Hwy 74, or.  Andrew Jackson Hwy) turns into Franklin Blvd., (THE) Boulevard. AFTER you cross over the railroad tracks. Gilmore's is just a bit further on the Left. Look for the banners on the sidewalk in an older brick building on the left. Parking is between 2 buildings, slopes downhill and kind of a squeeze. You can probably park in a lot at the bottom of the hill. Ignore the names on the building...previous owners of the building. The name plaques are there to honor them and for ambiance. They roast their coffee In-House. Many choices in coffee. I like their Americano (their secret blend). They also have some infused olive-oils. We haven't tried that yet. Also, there's a lot of other neat items in the shop. I see a nice area for the kids to hang out in also. Check them out.
Love this coffee shop! Tons of local gifts. Also, coffee beans, infused olive oils, spices and teas. Awesome place to spend a morning!
Very quiet and quaint place. I appreciate a coffee shop such as this. I hope to visit again in the near future
I love going here, it is so relaxing, and the people there are always so nice. I enjoy tasting all the vinegars and olive oils. The teas are great and so is the coffee.
Very cool old building. Tin ceiling and huge tin crown molding still intact. Plenty of seating and odd assortment of things for sale. We will return.
I would consider myself a coffee spot connesuier, and the place meets my needs with great customer service, Rachel and her staff have a really nice thing going! The coffee is amazing too!
Love this family

Cute place to shop for unique gifts on TOP of being a great coffee shop with food and desserts.

Great selection of coffee beans, different kinds of spices and (olive) oils, much more than it appears to be.
Great place to relax with a coffee...
Excellent place for coffee and a chat. Many oils to choose from in this eclectic environment
Great coffee, cute decor, and some of the best olive oil and balsamic vinegars I've ever had
Amazing coffee and super random and fun collection of items for sale... Jesse is a little ray of morning sunshine as she so attentively creates each customer's perfect coffee beverage.
This place is delicious!! Service with a smile and enough coffee to keep you awake for days, lol. All kinds of extras to see and buy. It's definitely worth a visit and a cup of joe.
Midnight shift coffee is great.
Jesse is the absolute sweetest. She helped me pick out some delicious fresh coffee beans. I love the flavored oil and vinegars.
Super friendly and coffee is amazing!
Great place for coffee and fun gifts.

Nice home decor, loose leaf tea and coffee shop in downtown Gastonia. The staff is friendly and the coffee is affordable and good. They have many flavor options to choose from for a latte and a small selection of pastries.

The baristas were very friendly and sweet!
Excellent selection of coffee and a comfortable  chair to sit in while drinking coffee and catching up on email and calls.

I visit Gilmore's every morning for coffee and it is an absolute delight.  The coffee is delicious, customer service is genuine and the homemade baked goods are to amazing!
Thank you Gilmore's!
Fantastic coffee and work space!

A lovely find. Great coffee and teas - great selection of gift and home items. An old-timey comfy vibe!  I wish it had larger signage so it is more visible when driving by.  Thank you, Rachel for bringing this gem to Gastonia!!  Give it a go - you won't regret!!!
Legit the best coffee spot and at a great price, the workers are so kind and interactive with the customers, it's as if you were family.  I will definitely be coming back along with my friends!

What a fun and unexpected gem in downtown Gastonia. Freshly roasted coffee beans, yummy espresso drinks, lots of curated gifts for purchase. Plus friendly hosts with a great back story. Parking down the side of the building.

Lovely experience at Gilmore's.
Very friendly and helpful.  Chock full  o' stuff!
Chock full o' coffee!.
They have ground and whole beans.
They grounds some whole beans for me on the spot!
They have some unique special blends not found anywhere else on Earth!
Bought a pound of " Midnight in G-Town " blend. Had some this morning, 5-13-2023.
Excellent! I look forward to more tomorrow!
Highly recommend.
If you are reading this, then you need to go check out Gimore's!
Great espresso, made the authentic way
Very good coffee. I don't like most coffee at restaurants, this was very good.

Love stopping in for coffee during my lunch break. Really great finds in the store, and super friendly staff! Lots of unique gifts too.

My only reccomendation would be improving the signage, maybe with a perpendicular wall sign on the front. So more people can see y'all driving down Franklin instead of after they pass.
Love this place. Just what we needed here. Friendly and lots of great items fr sale

Awesome atmosphere and good coffee at good prices.  Tons of sugar-free options, if that's important to you.

Also, there's WAY more to buy here than just coffee!  Check it out!

Cool place where you can have coffee and buy infused oils and vinegars of good quality, coffee beans of may different types, some clothing, local honey, etc.  It's definitely worth more that one visit!
Have an inflammatory bowel disease and the wide range of olive oils and balsamic vinegars help me to stay on my diet with flavorful food.
Thanks for the Mommy break today!
Nice place and good coffee.
We went this morning to check it out.  It was great.  The oil, vinegar and spice variety was something that Gaston County needed.  The coffee was great too!

Wow this place is a hidden gem. A charming little store front and coffee roaster. The owners were very friendly and accommodating. All the coffee was fresh and is roasted weekly. A great place for a date or to bring a book and enjoy some delicious coffee. Needless to say I will definitely be coming back. 6/5 stars

I love the southern charm. Must haves are the baked goods, the infused olive oils, and vinegars on display... The staff is extremely friendly, and the coffee beans are amazing.. Great place to relax over coffee or conversation.. I could go on and on, but you must try it for yourself...

This is an absolute gem of a coffee and gift shop in Gastonia, NC & I highly recommend you stop by!! Tasty roasts, oils & vinegars, local handmade items, baked goods, comfy chairs, tons of games to play, and just an overall warm and cozy atmosphere! Plus, we had INCREDIBLE service by Jessie (Thank you so much and we'll definitely be back!)
Jessie is super sweet and very knowledgeable and she took the time show us around. We got to see to the beast of a roasting machine they use in-house and she explained how the owner, Rachel, uses locally sourced beans. The place smells incredible, as you can imagine, and the coffee was delicious! So many roasts!
Oh - and did I mention the many oils and vinegars they have there that you can sample?! The strawberry balsamic was superb!
Their gift selection was quite ample. I picked up some luxurious Turkish bath towels for about $12 each. You CANNOT beat that! I also bought some fancy mint tea and an adorable locally crocheted snowflake ornament.
We came in just for coffee, but left with so much more; a real feeling a being part of the lovely Gastonia community. Do not miss this spot!!
Great little spot in downtown Gastonia with unique finds as well as olive oils, vinegars, spices, teas, coffees, etc.... Cozy, quaint and enviting. Will definitely be back!

I absolutely love this quaint little coffee shop that has come to Gastonia. Coffee is not the only thing they sell. They have imported olive oils with a variety of vinegars. They have a wide variety of spices, coffee, tea as well as other little things. It's a great gift shop to buy something for your friends and loved ones. Jess who is the barista is very kind and knowledgeable about flavors. She also is the baker of all the baked goods that they sell and they are fantastic!! I love taking my time looking at all the little things the shop has to offer. You've gotta stop in to check them out. I truly hope they stay open. They made Gastonia a better place to live. Come support local business!

I'm a coffee freak and after paying a few visits I can safely say this is the absolute best coffee I've ever had in my life and it's not even close. Never too sweet or bitter and super consistent and the prices are great. Side note: you must try their flavored cooking oils!

Get some R&R...

Richard and Rachel will take great care of you.
I love the place  and have been telling others about it.
Best iced coffee I ever had

Super friendly staff, inviting atmosphere. What a beautiful little gem with an amazing sense of community. Delicious house roasted coffee and tasty baked goods, board games available to play while sipping with friends. Lots of local handmade treasures. Also features an amazing loose leaf tea table and a spice wall that I can't wait to explore!
Yesterday was my first visit and today I'm bringing my daughter along. I have a feeling I will be visiting quite often!
It is a great place with many wonderful things to purchase, love the spices.
Great local shop with English coffee mugs, tea shop,  and other hard to find items
Best coffee in town
Becoming my new favorite for coffee.  Great place for a coffee, some shopping, and the customer service is excellent!
Absolutely love your coffee.. See you soon..
Such a quaint little place. The coffee was smooth and delicious. They have a wide variety of teas as well.
Great visit for coffee and a treat  this morning!  Very friendly. Rachel has brought a real gem to downtown Gastonia!

What a neat place! The lady was really nice and helpful. I ordered a cappuccino and she asked if i wanted any flavoring and what type of milk i wanted, I ordered it with almond milk. Will defiantly be back and try one of their cookies!

This is just the COOLEST store and I am so grateful that they've chosen Gastonia. The candy counter is amazing, old timey fixtures and all. So looking forward to bringing my daughter and my friends with kids here! Also, the oils and spice selection is superb. The owner Rachel was so gracious while helping me fill up two bottles of very unique oils. There is a coffee bar and ample comfortable seating, you could easily spend a day playing cards or reading a book or even go on a date! Also, their Baker supplied our baby shower with some of the most BEAUTIFUL and delicious gluten and dairy free sugar cookies.

This store is a winner. Must see!
My husband and I came in this afternoon and it was a wonderful experience! The proprietors were helpful and friendly and the products were wonderful. Will definitely come again!
Glad we found this place, looking forward to seeing it grow. Freshest coffee around.
Excellent customer service. I can't believe this place has been here for 5 months without me knowing, I'm sad I missed out on 5 months of excellent coffee from a family owned business. WILL return!

Tried this place out for the first time this weekend. We got there about 15 minutes before closing but the owners were very nice and helpful. Picked out a black pepper olive oil that I'm looking forward to using. Next time I'll try out the coffee!
From out of town stopped in awesome place great prices good coffee very nice people and a throw back to the past highly recommend this place
Another good place to meet your friends drink coffee and just hanging out
Bought a reusable travel mug and fill it up every Sat AM. These folks are so kind and eager to please!
Unique, friendly, and peaceful. Stop by for something different.

The ladies are friendly. I was stuck in Gastonia (long story) and they let me chill there for 2 hours while i waited for my ride. I had the iced mocha latte which was delicious. They sell Cheerwine soda and assorted snacks. It's family-owned.

Small coffee bar that also sells locally made specialty teas. Has a great aged oil/basalmic vinegar section for all you healthy folks that you can buy by the decanter. Clean place with a well thought out layout. Ladies... There's a children's section that has crayons, books, and all sorts of stuff to keep them occupied while you chat at one of the booths! Rachel (the owner) and Sam (her daughter) are ready to help you with a good knowledge of the products they sell.
A great place to sit and share a cup of coffee with a friend.

I went to this place and I have never felt at home so quickly before.  Mom  and I were immediately greeted and helped! We only live a few miles away so we will definitely return! I bought a pound of coffee and can't wait to try it!!

Purchased a half pound bag of their darkest roast coffee -- which they roast in house!! -- because after my free sample of it in the shop I couldn't walk away. It was so smooth it's almost sweet, even taking it black. These guys know their coffee.
They also have an incredible selection of infused olive oils and flavored vinaigrettes, a really nice array of teas and spices, just a really good one-stop shop for the kitchen staples at really affordable prices. Will be returning for another bag of the coffee, and more besides!

Heard about this place through my pork supplier, Basswood Creek Farm, as this is one of their pickup locations. Decided to see what it was all about since I was out of coffee at home. Delightful little store, family owned and run. I want to come back to enjoy a cup of coffee and sit for a while one morning. Many of my favorite things here: kitchen items (like Lodge cast iron), spices, teas, quality olive oil... And taste testing! Always fun. I was a little confused about parking as there are no signs indicating I am in the right place, but Google did not lead me astray.
Fantastic coffee, reasonable prices, and priceless 1930s style ambiance.  A little hard to find, it's right next door to the dry cleaners, but well worth finding. My new favorite place !!

It's definitely hard to find good service nowadays. These guys hands down gave me the best that I have gotten in a very long time. They were very nice and informative. I will definitely be recommending to all my friends and family to check these guys out.
I love this place!! Great coffee and they are very nice and helpful.

Gilmore's Mercantile is my favorite new coffee place! The staff is friendly, the coffee is tasty, and the environment is cozy. There is a kids corner with books and blocks and several tables and booths and armchairs to get comfortable in. They roast their own coffee varieties - over 15 that I saw this morning. We have started buying our homebrew here and love it. They also have lots of cute country store type of items, like toys and candies. Other specialties include teas, fresh spices, and more than a few varieties of specialty cooking oils and vinegars. What a special place!
Smooth coffee, great assortment of specialty oils, vinegars, and spices and more!

I had great conversation with Rachel, the owner, who was as kind and helpful as she could be. I grabbed two varieties of whole beans for home (great selection) and a cup of brewed Colombian to go. I look forward to returning to explore the vast offerings in this beautiful shop when I have more time. Wishing you all so much success, Rachel and family!
Great roasted coffee!
This place is extremely nice, the staff is extremely polite. Great place for a lunch break or a place to sit and relax. The coffee is awesome as well.
A very huge selection of seasonings, flavored cooking oils and vinegars. Huge selection of fresh coffee beans that they will grind for you. Very friendly atmosphere and customer service is great!
I love the variety of coffee blends and oils and the atmosphere of this shop. My favorite coffee blends are Guatemalan and Tanzanian!
Very nice place, great coffee selection. The oil and vinegar section is very cool and has a lot of options. They are still in the process of opening but it's definitely worth a look.
